ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit

Class InterceptSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.InterceptSource

  • public final class InterceptSource
extends Object
    An instance of this class is provided as the source to an action listener that has been set as a key stroke interceptor with InputHandler.interceptNextKeyStroke(java.awt.event.ActionListener).
    Since:
    3.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JSourceCodeEditor getEditor()
      Returns the editor from which the key was intercepted.
      KeyEvent getKeyEvent()
      Returns the key event which is being intercepted.
      KeyStroke getKeyStroke()
      Returns they key stroke for the key event which is being intercepted.
      void handleEvent()
      Handle the event normally.
      boolean isPressed()
      Returns true if the event being intercepted is a "pressed" event.
      boolean isReleased()
      Returns true if the event being intercepted is a "released" event.
      boolean isTyped()
      Returns true if the event being intercepted is a "typed" event.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • getEditor

        public JSourceCodeEditor getEditor()
        Returns the editor from which the key was intercepted.
        Returns:
        the editor

      • getKeyEvent

        public KeyEvent getKeyEvent()
        Returns the key event which is being intercepted.
        Returns:

      • getKeyStroke

        public KeyStroke getKeyStroke()
        Returns they key stroke for the key event which is being intercepted.
        Returns:
        the key stroke

      • handleEvent

        public void handleEvent()
        Handle the event normally. The event will be resubmitted to the editor's input handler. Note that if this interceptor has explicitly re-set the interceptor value, the new interceptor will be invoked.

      • isPressed

        public boolean isPressed()
        Returns true if the event being intercepted is a "pressed" event.
        Returns:
        true for key pressed events

      • isReleased

        public boolean isReleased()
        Returns true if the event being intercepted is a "released" event.
        Returns:
        true for key released events

      • isTyped

        public boolean isTyped()
        Returns true if the event being intercepted is a "typed" event.
        Returns:
        true for key typed events
